issue that describes the problem/issue/bug this PR solves.
-->
This PR is to add an initial implementation of the Generalized Conjugate Residual (GCR) solver. This solver is needed by Gemma used with its Schur-complement PCA preconditioner. The GCR algorithm is based on the algorithm described in the "Iterative Methods for Sparse Linear Systems" book (by Yousef Saad). Currently, this implementation only supports single RHS and left preconditioner. Mutilple RHS and right preconditioner will be implemented in future PRs.

issue.title: Framework: Speed up CUDA PR builds/tests

labels.name: impacting: tests
labels.description: The defect (bug) is primarily a test failure (vs. a build failure)

labels.name: impacting: configure or build
labels.description: The issue is primarily related to configuring or building

labels.name: PA: Framework
labels.description: Issues that fall under the Trilinos Framework Product Area

labels.name: autotester
labels.description: Issues related to the autotester.

issue.body:
Scan a machine for NVidia GPUs, and if found, assign them all to the ctest instance with 2 slots each.

This will be coupled with some rearrangement of the PR pool such that each GPU machine only runs one GPU PR at a time, and nothing else.

@trilinos/framework 

## Motivation
Want more robust test results, and faster ones too. Seeing repeated flaky testing on the GPU PR runs and suspect it's due to multiple autotester instances using the same GPU. I've monitored this and there can be as many as 8 MPI ranks communicating with GPU 0, but all of the others are always idle.

## Related Issues
#11361 
[TRILFRAME-522](https://sems-atlassian-son.sandia.gov/jira/browse/TRILFRAME-522)

issue.title: change std::unary_function and std::binary_function call to C++17 com…
issue.body:
Trilinos defaults to c++17 standard, but there are functions, e.g. [unary_function](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/utility/functional/unary_function) and [binary_function](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/utility/functional/binary_function) that are removed in c++17 and replaced with __binary_function and __unary_function, these must be replaced

The incomplete compatibility with the default c++17 standard creates problems for more pedantic compilers (I'm looking at you apple-clang).


https://github.com/trilinos/Trilinos/labels/pkg%3A%20Panzer

issue.title: Stokhos(fixes #11398): Set alg defaults depending on cusparse version
issue.body:
@etphipp 

## Motivation

A while ago, we had seen in issue #11398 that the cuSparse's alg defaults for SPMV/SPMM depend on the cuSparse version. 

This PR is a fix that follows what was done in e.g. `KokkosSparse_spmv_tpl_spec_decl.hpp` to address the same issue. 

Fixes #11398.

issue.title: Framework: Speed up CUDA PR builds/tests

labels.name: impacting: tests
labels.description: The defect (bug) is primarily a test failure (vs. a build failure)

labels.name: impacting: configure or build
labels.description: The issue is primarily related to configuring or building

labels.name: PA: Framework
labels.description: Issues that fall under the Trilinos Framework Product Area

labels.name: autotester
labels.description: Issues related to the autotester.

issue.body:
Scan a machine for NVidia GPUs, and if found, assign them all to the ctest instance with 2 slots each.

This will be coupled with some rearrangement of the PR pool such that each GPU machine only runs one GPU PR at a time, and nothing else.

@trilinos/framework 

## Motivation
Want more robust test results, and faster ones too. Seeing repeated flaky testing on the GPU PR runs and suspect it's due to multiple autotester instances using the same GPU. I've monitored this and there can be as many as 8 MPI ranks communicating with GPU 0, but all of the others are always idle.

## Related Issues
#11361 
[TRILFRAME-522](https://sems-atlassian-son.sandia.gov/jira/browse/TRILFRAME-522)
